action.action-desc: Ms. Speier (for herself, Mr. Meehan, Mr. Coffman, and Mr. Johnson of Georgia) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committee on Armed Services, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006 to require the Secretary of Defense maintain a registry of sex offenders.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Military Track Register and Alert Communities Act of 2015 or as the Military TRAC Act .
Section 111 of the Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006 (42 U.S.C. 16911) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The term military offender means an individual who was convicted of a military offense specified by the Secretary of Defense under section 115(a)(8)(C)(i) of Public Law 105–119 (10 U.S.C. 951 note), or an attempt or conspiracy to commit such an offense.

section.header: Secretary of Defense to maintain a registry for military sex offenders
section.text: Section 112 of the Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006 (42 U.S.C. 16912) is amended in subsection (a), by inserting after Each jurisdiction the following: , and, for military offenders, the Secretary of Defense (including any military offender serving in the Coast Guard, without regard to the department in which the Coast Guard is operating),.

subsection.text: Section 113(a) of the Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006 (42 U.S.C. 16913(a)) is amended by inserting before the period at the end the following: , and, in the case of a military offender, with the Secretary of Defense.

Section 114(b) of the Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006 (42 U.S.C. 16914(b)) is amended by inserting after in which the sex offender registers the following: , and, in the case of military offenders, the Secretary of Defense,.

subsection.header: Public access to sex offender information
subsection.text: Section 118 of the Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006 (42 U.S.C. 16918) is amended by inserting , and, in the case of military offenders, the Secretary of Defense, after jurisdiction each place it appears.
Section 119 of the Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006 (42 U.S.C. 16919) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by inserting after jurisdiction’s sex offender registry the following: , and, in the case of military offenders, the registry of the Secretary of Defense,; and
in subsection (b), by inserting after all relevant jurisdictions the following: and, in the case of military offenders, the Secretary of Defense.

subsection.header: Sjodin National Sex Offender Public Website
subsection.text: Section 120(b) of the Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006 (42 U.S.C. 16920(b)) is amended by inserting after a jurisdiction’s Internet site the following: , and, in the case of a military offender, the appropriate Internet site of the Secretary of Defense.

subsection.header: Kanka and Zapp Community Notification Program
subsection.text: Section 121 of the Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006 (42 U.S.C. 16921) is amended by inserting after appropriate official in the jurisdiction the following: (and, in the case of military offenders, the Secretary of Defense).

subsection.header: Actions taken when offender fails To comply
subsection.text: Section 122 of the Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006 (42 U.S.C. 16922) is amended by inserting after jurisdiction’s registry the following: (and, in the case of military offenders, the registry of the Secretary of Defense).

subsection.header: Development and availability of registry software
subsection.text: Section 123 of the Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006 (42 U.S.C. 16923) is amended by inserting , and, in the case of military offenders, the Secretary of Defense, after jurisdictions each place it appears.

subsection.header: Registration of sex offenders entering the United States
subsection.text: Section 128 of the Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006 (42 U.S.C. 16928) is amended by inserting after the relevant jurisdictions the following: , and, in the case of military offenders, the Secretary of Defense,.

section.text: This Act and the amendments made by this Act shall take effect 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act.
